channel.title: Kick you when you're afk
channel.description: how can i make it so after roughly 10 minutes of being afk you automatically get kicked?

item.title: Kick you when you're afk
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

i found this in the client. Looks like time is edited client sided

super.idleTime++; if (super.idleTime > 4500) { anInt1011 = 250; super.idleTime -= 500; stream.createFrame(202); }

find something like that in mainGameProcessor

Read full topic

item.title: Kick you when you're afk
item.dc:creator: @gettwisted gettwisted
item.description:
@gettwisted wrote:

Okay, so the idle time is around 3 minutes, i dunno how to change it but i’m fine with it. How can i make it so if i’m an owner or admin it doesn’t log me out? add like?
}
else ifc.playerrights >= 2
}

Read full topic

item.title: Kick you when you're afk
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“gettwisted, post:8, topic:526321”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=645064.msg4339729#msg4339729 date=1374975977]

my idlelogout.java is:

package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;

public class IdleLogout implements PacketType {

@Override
public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
	//if (!c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Sabsabi"))
		//c.logout();
}

}

remove the // from //c.logout
[/quote]

Thanks man, how do i change how long it takes? like 15 minutes/hour? Sorry, I’ve just recently gotten back into coding and a lot has changed.[/quote]You want to find out how long the current idle packet is. Just sit there and watch your screen and see how long it takes for it to log out. I’ve never actually looked to see how it’s sent, but I’d assume it’s 30s or one minute or so. You’ll then want a counter variable for each player that is incremented each time the packet is received. In the IdleLogout class you’d then add an if statement to check if(player.idlelogoutcounter > (logouttimeinseconds/logoutincrement)) for the logout call. And then in all of your other packet handlers you’d set that idle counter to 0.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick you when you're afk
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

If you use the 317 protocol the client acutely sends a packet for when you’re idle.

EDIT: Packet 202 should do the trick, it will be sent when a player is idle for more then 60 seconds, after which it will be sent again every 10 seconds.

Read full topic
